profileAlternative.name: Ryan Carroll
profileAlternative.headline: Frontend Developer-turned-Recruiter - Networking with senior, lead and architect-level engineers in Philadelphia
profileAlternative.summary:
4.5 years at a technology start-up connecting employers to professionals with disabilities, 3 years as social marketing program manager, 3 years as a digital project manager. Relocated to Philadelphia in June 2017 and joined the Digital & Creative Services team at TEKsystems, the world's largest IT staffing and services provider. Focused on networking with top digital and creative talent in Philadelphia, and getting connected to the Philadelphia nonprofit community.

Recruiting Inquiries: rcarroll@teksystems.com 610.230.3865
Freelance Inquiries: rcarroll321@gmail.com 410.868.2250

positions.title: Emerging Technology Recruiter
positions.description:
I transitioned to recruiting in 2017, and used my technical skills to elevate the Philadelphia office's ability to recruit senior, lead, principal and architect-level software engineers in the emerging open source space: JavaScript, .NET Core, GoLang and a range of niche Python, Java, Rails and PHP.
TEKsystems in the largest IT staffing and services company in the United States, with 90 offices in North America, $4B in annual revenue and 80,000+ consultants on assignment at 6,000+ clients. We help companies build out new in-house product engineering teams to accomplish what they used to outsource. We achieve this by focusing on the candidate: Because every business problem can be solved when the right engineers are put in a position to succeed.
*2018 Contest Winner, generating $630K+ in annual revenue; grew from $3K to $30K in weekly revenue in 9 months
*2018 Recruiter of the Year for Philadelphia Applications division (~25 recruiters)
*2018 Hardest Worker of the Year for Philadelphia Applications division
*2018 Partnership of the Year for Philadelphia Applications division (shared with account manager)
*Voted September 2018 FSG Partner of the Month
*Led all TEKsystems recruiters in placements at a strategic national account
*Led efforts to improve recruitment delivery through “lunch and learns” on advanced topics, and serving as subject matter expert on recruitment technology and workforce analytics
…
see more

positions.title: Account Manager, Disability Talent & Branding Solutions
positions.description:
GettingHired, an Allegis Group Company, is a recruitment solution dedicated to helping inclusive employers hire professional individuals and veterans with disabilities.

It’s important for organizations to recognize that diversity in hiring does not simply mean a focus on gender and ethnicity. We connect skilled professionals to inclusive employers and advocacy organizations in the private and non-profit sectors, giving our employers direct access to the untapped labor pool of people with disabilities.

We provide employers with a full-service solution for attracting, recruiting, hiring and retaining the talent they need to meet their goals while also complying with OFCCP regulations. We provide job seekers with a fully-accessible career portal and connections to various employment resources.

As an industry leader in connecting employers to individuals with disabilities, GettingHired understands the challenge employers face to build an inclusive strategy as well as individuals with disabilities face to find employment. We are dedicated to face these challenges as your ally in building a thriving and inclusive workplace by providing consultation, resources and solutions. Let us connect you with a professional community of job seekers with disabilities to help your business flourish.

For more information, visit our website at www.gettinghired.com.
…
see more

positions.description:
Led global social media strategy development and integrated program execution for top-tier clients in the home, building and heavy equipment industries

Served as subject matter expert for clients facing complex regulatory challenges to their marketing campaigns, most notably with EPA emissions and LEED building standards

Managed integrated team of social marketing experts and $630K in social marketing spend.

given.text:
Ryan and I worked together to find me a new role after I got laid off, and his insights into the local tech job market were absolutely indispensable. Not only did he help me focus on companies that were the right size and cultural fit for me, but I credit his helping me prep for an important interview as the reason why I eventually received an offer from a company I really wanted to work for. Ryan is by far the most down to earth, honest, and passionate recruiter I've ever worked with. He cares deeply about placing qualified people in the right place and helping to improve the quality of tech talent in the region. If you're ever thinking about finding a job and need some help, definitely give Ryan a call.
…
See more

I have rarely encountered a person who works harder or with more passion than Ryan does. He is 100% dedicated to GettingHired's mission of connecting jobseekers with disabilities to inclusive employers. He does not bring up a problem without also proposing a solution, and he has been instrumental in formulating the strategies and processes that have led to GettingHired's success. I truly enjoy working with Ryan and I am excited to see what great things he will continue to do for GettingHired and AGS.
…
See more

To Whom It May Concern, Ryan has been a great motivator and one of the most hardworking people I've ever had the privilege of being around. He puts his best foot forward everyday and will help other employees shine and grow. You and I have never met (to whom is reading this), but I know you'd be lucky to have Ryan Carroll on your team. My advice? Take him and don't look back. He will be the best decision you've made in a long time. His commitment and loyalty are unparalleled and will definitely be an asset to any company.
…
See more

What is there not to say that isn't good about Ryan? Just read his summary and one sentence sums up everything you need to know about him..."But then I found my passion: Helping people get jobs. And I just could...not...turn...it...off." Ryan is PASSIONATE about helping people follow their dreams. He combines that passion with extensive knowledge of industries and hiring. He is also relentless in helping people he connects with. His knowledge of helping people with disabilities find competitive employment and the intricacies of the industry was very valuable to what Ryan has helped me with. I would recommend Ryan to anyone who is looking for a job in any industry, quite frankly, because he is the type of person that would learn a new area just to help them land something they want.
…
See more

received.text: I had the pleasure of working with Cecily on a joint business development effort to increase adoption of a new service line within her company's largest accounts. I quickly learned that Cecily has the unique ability to connect the dots between her client's biggest challenges, and the full range of services her company offers. She brings this quality to work as a client consultant, as a team leader, and on the business development trail. I hope to work with Cecily again in any capacity, be it as a vendor, team leader or partner.

I had the privilege of teaching Justin an 8-week computer skills course at Christopher Place Academy. I was immediately (and continually) dazzled by his incredible discipline with course material, and his more intangible talents for team leadership, intellectual curiosity, time management and strategic thinking. Not only did Justin complete every assignment to an unrivaled standard, he also offered detailed recommendations on how to improve our curriculum by integrating it more closely with assignments from his other instructors. I would recommend Justin for any position requiring a candidate to obsess over details, yet never neglect the big picture.
